stepsMakingAvatar.title: 1. Build your avatar
stepsMakingAvatar.description: Choose a character that looks like you.

stepsMakingAvatar.title: 2. Add someone you know who is vulnerable to contagious diseases
stepsMakingAvatar.description: Think about babies, older people, or those with chronic diseases or cancer. Vulnerable people can get sicker than other people if they catch a contagious disease.

stepsMakingAvatar.title: 3. Add a second vulnerable person
stepsMakingAvatar.description: Think about babies, older people, or those with chronic diseases or cancer. Vulnerable people can get sicker than other people if they catch a contagious disease.

stepsMakingAvatar.title: 4. Complete your group with six others in your circle
stepsMakingAvatar.description: Think of people you see often: for example, family, friends, colleagues, neighbours.

stepsDescription.description: Choose and customize an avatar to represent you.
Choose your hair color. Select accessories (glasses, facial hair) if you want, and save your avatar.

Now choose and customize ### avatars of people around you who are at greater risk if they get sick: babies or children, older people, people dealing with a health condition (cancer, diabetes, asthma, etc.) or people who have other health risks.
Finally, choose and customize ### other avatars. These represent other people around you.
Once all ### avatars are made, click or tap the green button to go to the animation.
Click green button to start the animation.

vulnerableOptions.name: A person with a more fragile immune system (cancer, diabetes, or other conditions)
